meanings.sent1: The basketball team was able to outrebound their opponents in every game.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outrebound her competitors during matches.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outrebound the dog in catching the toy.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outrebound obstacles in her path is truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The student's ability to outrebound distractions and focus on studying is commendable.

meanings.definition: To gain more rebounds than an opponent.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player was able to outrebound the other team consistently.
meanings.sent2: The key to winning was to outrebound the opposing team in every quarter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to outrebound the birds in collecting nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outrebound her fears and take risks paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategy to outrebound their rivals led them to victory.
